title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1963.4 - Small estate administration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1963.4 - Small estate administration

State Regulations
1. In a proceeding under article 13 of
the SCPA, the court may require submission of a third party affidavit of
kinship if it is alleged that the petitioner is the sole distributee of the
decedent. 2. The
certificate of letters of voluntary administrator, issued pursuant to article
13 of the SCPA, will specifically identify the alleged assets of an estate on
its face (bank name, account number, etc.) and limit the right of the voluntary
administrator to marshall only such identified assets. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1963.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
